intro: Osteospermum nervatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces showy yellow-orange flowers with white ray florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Osteospermum nervatum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
